meanings.definition: To make a harsh, shrill sound
meanings.sent1: The cat was scraighing loudly in the night.
meanings.sent2: I heard a bird scraighing in the distance.
meanings.sent3: The scraighing of the rusty gate sounded like a spooky ghost.
meanings.sent4: Her scraighing laughter pierced through the silence of the room.
meanings.sent5: The scraighing brakes of the car made everyone jump in surprise.

meanings.sent1: The scraighing of the chalk on the blackboard was unbearable.
meanings.sent2: The scraighing of the brakes echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent3: The scraighing of the violin made the audience cover their ears.
meanings.sent4: The scraighing of the microphone feedback startled the singer.
meanings.sent5: The scraighing of the seagulls filled the air with noise.
